Basic details: Michael Green, a 55-year-old male, presents to the clinic with complaints of dizziness.
Vitals:
BP: 140/90 mm Hg
Temp: 98.4°F (36.9°C)
RR: 18/minute
HR: 88/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sit in the chair and occasionally hold your head with your hand.
Exhibit slight unsteadiness when standing up.
If asked about recent falls, mention feeling off-balance but no falls.
If asked about hearing, mention occasional ringing in the ears.
Challenging question: "Could this dizziness be a sign of something serious like a stroke or a brain tumor?"
